body_html:
Ideally we don't have to scrape people's blogs for documentation but have it in the documentation. @drpngx closed the issue saying the docs are revamped. But really, on the topic of TFRecords usage there is still exactly that same single one: paragraph.https://www.tensorflow.org/programmers_guide/reading_data#reading_from_files.

One sentence readsThe recommended format for TensorFlow is a TFRecords file (..) ; given the fact that the paragraph on the topic consists of exactly 9 sentences, that's pretty weird.

TF is obviously great, and we could contribute ourselves here, but don't close the issue when it's obviously open. @ajschumacher how about contributing to the docs instead of the blog?

body:
Ideally we don't have to scrape people's blogs for documentation but have it in the documentation. @drpngx closed the issue saying the docs are revamped. But really, on the topic of TFRecords usage there is still exactly that same single one: paragraph.https://www.tensorflow.org/programmers_guide/reading_data#reading_from_files.

One sentence reads`The recommended format for TensorFlow is a TFRecords file (..) `; given the fact that **the paragraph on the topic consists of exactly 9 sentences**, that's pretty weird.

TF is obviously great, and we could contribute ourselves here, but don't close the issue when it's obviously open. @ajschumacher how about contributing to the docs instead of the blog?
